Message.TypeName: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Message.Issue: The query string passed to 'SqlCommand.CommandText.set(string)' in 'MsSqlServer.SqlExecCommand(string)' could contain the following variables 'command'. If any of these variables could come from user input, consider using a stored procedure or a parameterized SQL query instead of building the query with string concatenations.

Message.TypeName: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Message.Issue: The query string passed to 'SqlCommand.CommandText.set(string)' in 'MsSqlServer.SqlExecCommand(string, Dictionary<string, object>)' could contain the following variables 'command'. If any of these variables could come from user input, consider using a stored procedure or a parameterized SQL query instead of building the query with string concatenations.

Message.TypeName: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Message.Issue: The query string passed to 'SqlCommand.CommandText.set(string)' in 'MsSqlServer.SqlNoRetCommand(string)' could contain the following variables 'command'. If any of these variables could come from user input, consider using a stored procedure or a parameterized SQL query instead of building the query with string concatenations.

Message.TypeName: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Message.Issue: The query string passed to 'SqlCommand.CommandText.set(string)' in 'MsSqlServer.SqlScalarCommand(string)' could contain the following variables 'command'. If any of these variables could come from user input, consider using a stored procedure or a parameterized SQL query instead of building the query with string concatenations.
Modify 'MySqlServer.~MySqlServer()' so that it calls Dispose(false) and then returns.

'MySqlServer' implements a finalizer that only calls conditionally emitted methods or the base type finalizer. Remove the finalizer or ensure that it is only conditionally compiled into the assembly. If this violation occurs against a finalizer that is entirely wrapped in a conditionally-emitted block of code, suppress this message.

Rule.Name: Implement IDisposable correctly
Rule.Description: All IDisposable types should implement the Dispose pattern correctly.
Rule.Resolution: Modify {0} so that it calls Dispose(false) and then returns.

Rule.Name: Remove empty finalizers
Rule.Description: Finalizers should be avoided where possible, to avoid the additional performance overhead involved in tracking object lifetime.
Rule.Resolution: {0} implements a finalizer that only calls conditionally emitted methods or the base type finalizer. Remove the finalizer or ensure that it is only conditionally compiled into the assembly. If this violation occurs against a finalizer that is entirely wrapped in a conditionally-emitted block of code, suppress this message.

Rule.TypeName: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Rule.Name: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Rule.Description: A SQL command string built from user input is vulnerable to SQL injection attacks. Microsoft SQL Server and other database servers support stored procedures and parameterized SQL queries, which reduce the risk of injection attacks.
Rule.Resolution: The query string passed to {0} in {1} could contain the following variables {2}. If any of these variables could come from user input, consider using a stored procedure or a parameterized SQL query instead of building the query with string concatenations.
